cards.name: Arena Rector
cards.text: When Arena Rector dies, you may exile it. If you do, search your library for a planeswalker card, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle.
cards.flavorText: Her call echoes across worlds, calling the loyal to battle.

rulings.text: If Arena Rector leaves your graveyard before its triggered ability resolves, perhaps because it’s a token and ceased to exist, you can’t exile it and won’t be able to search your library for a planeswalker card.

cards.name: Enlightened Tutor
cards.text: Search your library for an artifact or enchantment card, reveal it, then shuffle and put that card on top.
cards.flavorText: The path offered by the academy is long and difficult, but those who brave it arrive at wisdom beyond compare.

rulings.text: The “shuffle and put the card on top” is a single action. If an effect causes the top card of the library to be face up, the second card down is not revealed.

cards.name: Spellseeker
cards.text: When Spellseeker enters the battlefield, you may search your library for an instant or sorcery card with mana value 2 or less, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle.
cards.flavorText: Not content with mere answers, she hunts for the truth.

rulings.text: If the mana cost of a card in your library includes {X}, X is considered to be 0.

cards.name: Demonic Tutor
cards.text: Search your library for a card, put that card into your hand, then shuffle.
cards.flavorText: "Mama says it's my imagination, but I know you'd never lie to me."

rulings.text: You pick a card on resolution.
You don’t reveal the card to your opponent.
This card is put directly into your hand. It is not drawn.

cards.name: Infernal Tutor
cards.text:
Reveal a card from your hand. Search your library for a card with the same name as that card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle.
Hellbent — If you have no cards in hand, instead search your library for a card, put it into your hand, then shuffle.

cards.name: Gamble
cards.text: Search your library for a card, put that card into your hand, discard a card at random, then shuffle.
cards.flavorText: As she triggered yet another trap, Chira realized that what she thought was the goblin word for "easy" probably wasn't.

rulings.text: You put the card into your hand and discard a card at random all while Gamble is resolving. Nothing can happen between the two, and no player may choose to take actions.
You might end up discarding the card you searched for. Casting this spell is a gamble.

cards.name: Birthing Pod
cards.text:
({G/P} can be paid with either {G} or 2 life.)
{1}{G/P}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Search your library for a creature card with mana value equal to 1 plus the sacrificed creature's mana value, put that card onto the battlefield, then shuffle. Activate only as a sorcery.

rulings.text: A card with Phyrexian mana symbols in its mana cost is each color that appears in that mana cost, regardless of how that cost may have been paid.
To calculate the mana value of a card with Phyrexian mana symbols in its cost, count each Phyrexian mana symbol as 1.

As you cast a spell or activate an activated ability with one or more Phyrexian mana symbols in its cost, you choose how to pay for each Phyrexian mana symbol at the same time you would choose modes or choose a value for X.
If you’re at 1 life or less, you can’t pay 2 life.
Phyrexian mana is not a new color. Players can’t add Phyrexian mana to their mana pools.

A creature’s mana value is determined solely by the mana symbols printed in its upper right corner (unless that creature is copying something else; see below). If its mana cost includes {X}, X is considered to be 0. If it has no mana symbols in its upper right corner (because it’s an animated land, for example), its mana value is 0. Ignore any alternative costs or additional costs (such as kicker) paid when the creature was cast.
A token has a mana value of 0, unless it is copying something else.
If a creature is copying something else, its mana value is the mana value of whatever it’s copying.

cards.name: Sylvan Tutor
cards.text: Search your library for a creature card, reveal it, then shuffle and put that card on top.
cards.flavorText: The whole of creation stood transfixed, silenced by the weight of anticipation.

rulings.text: Because the “search” requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don’t have to find the card if you don’t want to.

cards.name: Sterling Grove
cards.text:
Other enchantments you control have shroud. (They can't be the targets of spells or abilities.)
{1}, Sacrifice Sterling Grove: Search your library for an enchantment card, reveal it, then shuffle and put that card on top.

rulings.text: Because the “search” requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

cards.name: Eye of Ugin
cards.text:
Colorless Eldrazi spells you cast cost {2} less to cast.
{7}, {T}: Search your library for a colorless creature card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle.

rulings.text: Eye of Ugin doesn’t have a mana ability.

Eye of Ugin’s second ability lets you find any colorless creature card in your deck, such as an artifact creature card that has no colored mana symbols in its mana cost, or a creature card that’s become colorless due to Mycosynth Lattice.
Mistform Ultimus and creatures with changeling are Eldrazi. If they become colorless, possibly due to Mycosynth Lattice, Eye of Ugin would reduce the cost to cast them by {2}.
